title: Ukraine Expels Some Russian Troops in South
description: Moscow’s retreat has pulled back the curtain on a panorama of ruined towns and empty villages left in its wake.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing: Ukraine gains ground in south
description: Plus Elon Musk suggests buying Twitter at his original price and North Korea fires a missile over Japan

title: A U.N. investigation finds that Russian forces are torturing civilian and military prisoners.
4 Women Will Staff U.K. Base in Antarctica
description: They emerged from an applicant pool of thousands to run the world’s most southerly post office, monitor penguins and manage the wild landscape on Goudier Island.

title: 4 Women Will Staff U.K. Base in Antarctica
description: They emerged from an applicant pool of thousands to run the world’s most southerly post office, monitor penguins and manage the wild landscape on Goudier Island.

title: Ukraine’s top diplomat tries to counter Russia’s narrative on Africa tour.
description: “I arrived here and I hear, ‘Russia and Ukraine are one people,’” Ukraine’s foreign minister, Dmytro Kuleba, said in Senegal on the first stop of his 10-day trip across Africa.

title: Paid to Fight, Even in Ancient Greece
description: DNA from a 2,500-year-old battlefield in Sicily reveals that mercenary soldiers were common, if not the Homeric ideal.

title: Florida’s Leaders Opposed Climate Aid. Now They’re Depending on It.
description: Before Hurricane Ian, the state’s Republican politicians have rejected federal action to cut greenhouse gas emissions and boost climate resilience.

title: Iran Attacks Kurdish Positions Across the Border in Iraq
description: Tehran has blamed Kurdish groups for fomenting some of the protests that have convulsed Iran for almost three weeks.

title: Rebekah Vardy Ordered to Pay Legal Fees in ‘Wagatha Christie’ Case
description: Ms. Vardy will pay 90 percent of Coleen Rooney’s legal costs, an estimated $1.7 million, after losing a libel case that proved irresistible to the British press.

title: Protecting the Peatlands of Ireland as Fuel Costs Skyrocket
description: One in seven Irish households still burn peat for heat. New rules are aimed at discouraging a practice that many consider part of the culture.

title: ‘Did You See Your Parents Fall?’ Tear Gas, a Stampede, and a Family Shattered
description: Muhammad Yulianto and Devi Ratna Sari took their young son to his first soccer match. The young couple were among the 125 who died in the tragedy at the Indonesian stadium.

title: Ukraine Gains Momentum on the Battlefield After a Bruising Summer
description: As Ukraine takes back territory, it is making ground toward the city of Lysychansk, which fell to the Russians only three months ago.

title: A Public Health Success Story
description: We revisit the subject of Covid and racial inequities.

title: Zelensky promises a ‘clear and fair’ approach in reclaimed territory.
She Says She Was Raped in Parliament. Now, Her Case Is Before a Court.
description: The trial of the Australian man accused of sexually assaulting Brittany Higgins will be viewed against the backdrop of the global #MeToo movement.

title: Russia’s War in Ukraine Sends Swedish Marines Into the Arms of NATO
description: Russia’s war in Ukraine has sent marines from famously neutral Sweden into the arms of NATO, where they have begun working with American forces.

title: Climate Change for Preschoolers: A TV Show Explores Unmapped Ground
description: There are almost no books, TV shows or other tools to help parents and teachers talk to preschoolers about climate change. “Octonauts: Above and Beyond” is one of the first to try.

title: What Video Footage Reveals About the Protests in Iran
description: The New York Times analyzed dozens of videos circulating online for insights about what is propelling the demonstrations, and how women are leading the movement.

title: Nobel Prize in Physics to Be Awarded Today
description: The second Nobel announced this year will be presented by the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences in Stockholm.

title: Journalist Percy Lapid Is Fatally Shot in the Philippines
description: The radio host Percival Mabasa was killed during an ambush, the police said. He had been a prominent critic of President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. and his predecessor, Rodrigo Duterte.

title: At Long Last, Can Malaria Be Eradicated?
description: Two new vaccines may finally turn back an ancient plague. But in unexpected ways, their arrival also complicates the path to ending the disease.

title: North Korea Fires Ballistic Missile Over Japan in Major Escalation
description: The missile flew about 2,800 miles, the longest distance ever traveled by a North Korean missile, officials in Tokyo and Seoul said.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: Ukraine’s advances against Russian forces.

title: Scouting for Firewood, or for Russia? On the Front Line in Ukraine.
description: Outside the city of Lyman, Ukrainian troops ran across a 69-year-old Soviet veteran. He was placed in an improvised blindfold. All were enveloped in the fog of war.

title: Three Ways to Build Back Smarter After Hurricane Ian
description: Big storms more becoming more common. That makes it crucial to take climate change into account when rebuilding.

title: Small Leak Is Still Visible From Nord Stream 2 pipeline, Swedish Officials Say
description: Damage to the gas line was discovered last week under the Baltic Sea.

title: François Legault Wins Re-election in Quebec
description: Voters in Quebec gave a second term to Premier François Legault, who has shifted the province from a once fervent-independence movement to a nationalism focused on French Québécois identity.

title: Art Withers in a Country Where Anything Can Be Deemed a Threat
description: In Bangladesh, a crackdown on free speech has left filmmakers in a Kafkaesque bind as their movies are blocked for vague reasons.

title: Blinken Meets With Gustavo Petro of Colombia Amid Differences
description: The Biden administration disagrees with President Gustavo Petro’s views on the drug war, Venezuela and Cuba, but hopes to retain the historically strong ties the United States has with Bogotá.

title: CDC Ends Country-by-Country Covid Travel Advisories
description: The agency said it would no longer maintain a list of coronavirus travel warnings because “fewer countries are testing or reporting Covid-19 cases,” limiting its ability to assess travel risks.

title: In Retreat on Ukrainian Fronts, Russia Shows Signs of Disarray
description: Confusion and recriminations marked the Russian efforts to call up draftees and claim sovereignty over Ukrainian territory, as well as the Russian response to battlefield setbacks.
